subtitle: This richly spiced dish is a typical South Indian dish which is often referred to as a festive dish. It uses tamarind juice specifically to cut through the sweetness of the aubergine.

method.text: Cut each aubergine in half lengthways, leaving each stalk intact. Make 2 further deep cuts in the aubergines leaving the sections held together by the stem.
In a heavy-based saucepan, gently dry fry the onion, coconut, sesame, poppy and coriander seeds, red chillies, ginger and garlic for 1-2 min or until roasted.
Rub a little of the dried spice paste into the cuts and leave to stand for 10 min.

Meanwhile heat the oils in a frying pan and fry the cumin seeds and chilli together for 2 min. Add the aubergines and fry for 3-5 min on all sides over a high heat. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.
Spoon the remaining paste into the pan and cook for 1-2 min or until thickened. Return the aubergines to the pan and simmer gently for 10-15 min or until thoroughly cooked.
Stir in the tamarind juice or lime juice and serve.

title: Bagare baingan - spiced aubergines
